DOC.brief_summary: In this study the investigators wish to explore the potential neuroprotective effects of acute oral supplementation of lycopene, a natural anti-oxidant derived from tomatoes, on cerebral vasospasm and autoregulation, and examine whether any improvements translate into a reduction of biochemical markers of vascular injury and inflammation a decrease in the prevalence of secondary strokes following subarachnoid haemorrhage.
DOC.criteria: Age: > 18 years old, Confirmed aneurysmal subarachnoid hemorrhage (aSAH), Time from ictus < 96 hours Age: < 18 years old, Nonaneurysmal SAH, Time from ictus > 96 hours, Severe carotid atherosclerotic disease (â‰¥70%) Highdose statin therapy (>80 mg/day fluvastatin; >40 mg/day simvastatin; >40 mg/day pravastatin; >10 mg/day atorvastatin; >10 mg/day rosuvastatin 28), Allergy or hypersensitivity to tomatoes and tomato products and history of any other significant atopy/allergy (e.g. soy, whey, lutein, lecithin)
